security_audit.summary: After evaluating all static findings, this skill is determined to be LOW risk. The 479 detected patterns are primarily from documentation examples and standard CLI tool invocations. The subprocess calls use hardcoded command strings, not user input. File system access is limited to standard directories for session storage and downloads. Network access targets known public services (Z-Library, NotebookLM). The skill includes copyright compliance warnings.

content.value_statement: This skill automates downloading books from Z-Library and uploading them to Google NotebookLM. It handles format conversion, smart chunking for large files, and creates notebooks for AI-powered reading with zero hallucination.
actual_capabilities: Download books from Z-Library using saved browser sessions
Convert EPUB files to Markdown format automatically
Split large files into chunks for NotebookLM upload limits
Create NotebookLM notebooks and upload sources programmatically
Handle PDF files directly without conversion
limitations: Requires one-time login setup with browser automation
Only works with Z-Library links, not other book sources
May fail if Z-Library changes website structure
NotebookLM CLI tool must be installed separately

use_cases.title: Research paper workflows
use_cases.description: Download academic papers from Z-Library and create NotebookLM notebooks for AI-assisted research and analysis.

use_cases.title: Study material preparation
use_cases.description: Convert textbooks and study materials into NotebookLM notebooks for interactive learning and Q&A sessions.

use_cases.title: Personal knowledge library
use_cases.description: Build a personal knowledge base by uploading books to NotebookLM for conversational reading experiences.

prompt_templates.title: Basic download
prompt_templates.prompt: Use zlibrary-to-notebooklm to download this book and upload to NotebookLM: https://zh.zlib.li/book/12345/example-book

prompt_templates.title: Multiple books
prompt_templates.prompt: Download these three books to NotebookLM one by one: [link1], [link2], [link3]

prompt_templates.title: Check session
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if the Z-Library session is still valid, and let me know if re-login is needed.

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshoot issues
prompt_templates.prompt: The download failed. Check the troubleshooting guide and help me resolve the issue.

output: You can now ask: "What are the key concepts in this book?"

output_examples.input: Upload these three books to NotebookLM
output: All 3 notebooks are ready for AI-powered reading

best_practices: Run the login script once before first use to save browser session
Use PDF format when available for best formatting preservation
Process books one at a time to avoid session conflicts
Keep your Z-Library session valid for repeated use
anti_patterns: Do not use with links that require paid access or subscription
Avoid concurrent downloads that may conflict with browser sessions
Do not attempt to bypass copyright or access restrictions
Do not modify the session files manually

faq.question: Is this skill legal to use?
faq.answer: Use only for content you have legal access to. The skill includes copyright warnings and compliance reminders.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything?
faq.answer: Yes, install Playwright and the NotebookLM CLI tool before first use for full functionality.

faq.question: What file formats are supported?
faq.answer: PDF files are used directly. EPUB files are converted to Markdown. Other formats may require manual conversion.

faq.question: Why does it open a browser?
faq.answer: Playwright browser automation is used to handle Z-Library login and download interactions automatically.

faq.question: What happens to large files?
faq.answer: Files over 350,000 words are automatically split into smaller chunks for reliable NotebookLM upload.

faq.question: Can I use this with other book sources?
faq.answer:: This skill is designed specifically for Z-Library. For other sources, use local file upload with NotebookLM CLI directly.
